meanings.definition: Treat (a substance) with sulfuric acid or a sulfonic acid, especially to introduce a sulfonic group.
meanings.sent1: The chemist was sulfonating the compound to add a sulfonic group.
meanings.sent2: In the lab, they are sulfonating the solution to modify its properties.
meanings.sent3: The students found sulfonating the liquid strangely satisfying.
meanings.sent4: Sulfonating the mixture was like adding a secret ingredient to a recipe.
meanings.sent5: The process of sulfonating creates a powerful chemical transformation.

meanings.definition: To undergo a chemical reaction involving the introduction of a sulfonic group.
meanings.sent1: The substance will sulfonate when exposed to the acid.
meanings.sent2: When heated, the compound sulfonates and changes its structure.
meanings.sent3: The beaker seemed surprised when it started sulfonating on its own.
meanings.sent4: The molecules were sulfonating like dancers moving in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent5: The reaction was sulfonating rapidly, producing a new compound.
